intro: Miconia theaezans subsp. viridis, commonly known as the greenleaf miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green, often with a waxy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is sometimes considered a weed in certain ecosystems.
